section.heading: Tax credit to Qualified High Technology Companies for wages to qualified employees; exceptions.

para.text: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000, and ending on December 31, 2019, a Qualified High Technology Company shall be allowed a credit against the tax imposed by § 47-1807.02 equal to 10% of the wages paid during the first 24 calendar months of employment to a qualified employee hired after December 31, 2000.

Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2019, a Qualified High Technology Company shall be allowed a credit against the tax imposed by § 47-1807.02 equal to 5% of the wages paid during the first 24 calendar months of employment to a qualified employee hired after December 31, 2017.
The credit under subsections (a) and (a-1) of this section shall not be allowed:
To exceed, for each qualified employee:
$5,000 in a taxable year for the credit under subsection (a) of this section.
$3,000 in a taxable year for the credit under subsection (a-1) of this section.
If the Qualified High Technology Company accords the qualified employee lesser benefits or rights than it accords other employees in similar jobs;
If the qualified employee was employed as the result of:
The displacement, other than for cause, of another employee;
A layoff in which other employees are awaiting recall; or
A reduction of the regular wages, benefits, or rights of other employees in similar jobs; or
If the qualified employee is a member of the board of directors of the Qualified High Technology Company or, directly or indirectly, owns a majority of its stock.
A credit allowable under this section may be carried forward for 10 years if:
The amount of the credit allowable under this section exceeds the tax otherwise due from a Qualified High Technology Company; and
The amount of the credit allowable under this section was obtained for wages of a qualified employee hired before October 1, 2019.

annotations.annotation: This section is referenced in § 47-1818.01 and § 47-1818.06.
